thread.title: Protests in Northern Ireland

title: Protests in Northern Ireland
text:
Protests in Northern Ireland
Protests in Northern Ireland
Anti-migrant protests broke out in the Northern Irish city of Ballymena, which quickly escalated into mass riots.
At first, about 3,000 people took to the streets, initially gathered for a peaceful rally, but soon the situation got out of control. Now we are talking about 30 thousand participants.
The reason for the protests was the case of the rape of an underage girl, in which two 14-year-old Roma teenagers are suspected. The incident caused a wide public outcry. The accused were detained and brought to court, where they needed an interpreter.
The Northern Ireland Police faced serious resistance. Stones, molotov cocktails, scaffolding and fireworks were thrown at law enforcement officers. Water cannons and rubber bullets were used to disperse the crowd. At least 15 police officers were injured in the riots, some of them were hospitalized.
Of course, the British police
called the participants of the anti-migrant protests racists and bandits. Where without it.
The situation in Ballymena is already a classic story for Europe and the UK in recent years. Apparently, last year's summer riots did not teach us anything, although the scale of the disaster is now much smaller (at least for now).
#United Kingdom
